href=\"https://doi.org/10.1088/0004-637X/784/1/35\" class=\"link link-crossref openInAnotherWindow\" target=\"_blank\">Crossref</a></span></p>\u00a0</div></div></div></div></div><div content-id=\"bib79\" data-legacy-id=\"bib79\"><div class=\"refLink-parent\"><span class=\"refLink\"><a name=\"jumplink-bib79\" href=\"javascript:;\" aria-label=\"jumplink-bib79\"></a></span></div><div class=\"ref false\"><div id=\"ref-auto-bib79\" class=\"ref-content \"><div class=\"mixed-citation citation\"><p class=\"mixed-citation-compatibility\"><span class=\"person-group\"><span class=\"name string-name\"><div class=\"surname\">Yang</div>  <div class=\"given-names\">H.</div></span> et al.\u00a0</span>, <div class=\"year\">2017</div>, <div class=\"source \">ApJ</div>, <div class=\"volume\">844</div>, <div class=\"fpage\">171</div> <div class=\"pub-id\"><a href=\"https://doi.org/10.3847/1538-4357/aa7d4d\" class=\"link link-doi openInAnotherWindow\" target=\"_blank\">10.3847/1538-4357/aa7d4d</a></div></p><!--citationLinks: case 2--><div class=\"citation-links\"><p class=\"citation-links-compatibility\"><span class=\"crossref\"><a href=\"https://doi.org/10.3847/1538-4357/aa7d4d\" class=\"link link-crossref openInAnotherWindow\" target=\"_blank\">Crossref</a></span></p>\u00a0</div></div></div></div></div></div>                    <h3 scrollto-destination=118502183 id=\"118502183\" class=\"appendix-title\" data-legacy-id=app1>APPENDIX A</h3>\r\n                    <h4 scrollto-destination=118502184 id=\"118502184\" class=\"section-title\" data-legacy-id=sec6>ADDITIONAL MODS SPECTROSCOPY</h4>\r\n<p class=\"chapter-para\">The MODS1 spectroscopic observations included slits placed on interesting objects within the field of J1414+5446. These include a long slit aligned with the tangential arc T1 (masks 505919 and 523405), two slits for each of the radial arc candidates R1 and R2 (mask 510122), and cluster member galaxies selected through simple colour cuts. Specifically, the member galaxy candidates were targeted with the criteria <em>g</em> \u2212 <em>r</em> &gt; 1.2 and <em>r</em> \u2212 <em>i</em> &gt; 0.7 using the CFHTLS photometry. In total, these criteria select 662 objects within 6 arcmin of the BCG position to a depth of <em>i</em> &lt; 25. We targeted 52 galaxies within \u223c2.5 arcmin of the BCG, obtaining redshifts for 43 galaxies with 0.58 &lt; <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$z$|</span> &lt; 0.64 (the BCG redshift is <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$z$|</span> = 0.616). A few additional galaxies that did not meet the colour criteria were also targeted on order to fill the slit masks.</p><p class=\"chapter-para\">The full redshift catalogue from the MODS1 observations is given in Table <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-tbla1\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"tbla1\" data-open=\"tbla1\" class=\"link link-reveal link-table xref-fig\">A1</a>. Objects with <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$z$|</span> = 0 are confirmed late-type stars, while those with an empty redshift entry were not identifiable, usually due to low <em>S</em>/<em>N</em>. Typical errors on the redshifts are &lt;20 km s<sup>\u22121</sup>. Example MODS spectra are presented in Fig.\u00a0<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-figa1\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"figa1\" data-open=\"figa1\" class=\"link link-reveal link-table xref-fig\">A1</a>.</p>                        <a id=\"118502187\" scrollto-destination=\"118502187\"></a>\r\n<div data-id=\"figa1\" class=\"fig fig-section js-fig-section\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure A1.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/479/1/10.1093_mnras_sty1411/1/m_sty1411figa1.jpeg?Expires=1611465923&amp;Signature=IRbJDN0VV1BnvjIcQKWsUz3KrRcq6ArFrbZgz2VU~oZaG3DHGepNt8AupFqq5IROapahbpRTfEYNdWU9TrRxVo8YqgArNz9ceATPyEPsTnXTOR6Z~zMCsUrWHmaHWhLW-QbQMe3RuYHNTeSP4C74wBSKwornEy7u568Wk6qp9x~cRNXO6NMj-7Nvg8ElEzP0CBr9KO1BNfddWRqkq03ofYtcCRiOlPHAiZSW3X49S0jAIuPmIbloxtFSuqC1w5bVU9DFAf5CPf4jbnmwmov5mmO85~PSclqpX85UNdTw~32~hhdhIF0IwuH48LpSB9yx5X4Aa3AWADA-x62Q-O9U5A__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"Spectra of galaxies in the field of J1414+5446 targeted on MODS slitmasks. Spectra of the two candidate arcs R1 and R2 are presented in the top two panels; both are star-forming galaxies with strong emission lines. The unambiguous redshifts place them in the foreground of the lensing cluster. The third panel from the top shows the BCG spectrum, and the lowest panel a randomly selected cluster member galaxy that is representative of the quality of the MODS spectra.\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa1.jpg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/118502187/sty1411figa1.jpg\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa1.jpg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"118502187\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/479/1/10.1093_mnras_sty1411/1/sty1411figa1.jpeg?Expires=1611465923&Signature=lgvRZknAO-HatSCVQQSH5suXCtxj9tMFZLNtDTFlKUunwUa644In7Qx8beWRLCSJOR5YgX-S0P4xp1Lk6YJuv4icsVby1xsqvq2xJVLVbH3SvhRyUQnboDi~2DMWa9Htj5-sJp3EDBLRFXlKRfYhDmpsKXdjtbNVJMqYTisu4p6WyXSMHB9EM2GzKDnaWuYex0e8xUUpKIEedcH0lLFCgwvNyTcE643LatgT5Pg68sTTAtbfta3mOtpJHGO-HWHjE~bGAXOfuaz72QYHd3xTamrWvKoVzKEYNhOyqbi4-mBiNqEMKGF1Ghp5rd0nomAZmrDXUD6-YF1TCa3hE3~VTQ__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=118502187&ar=5026178&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa1.jpg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">Spectra of galaxies in the field of J1414+5446 targeted on MODS slitmasks. Spectra of the two candidate arcs R1 and R2 are presented in the top two panels; both are star-forming galaxies with strong emission lines. The unambiguous redshifts place them in the foreground of the lensing cluster. The third panel from the top shows the BCG spectrum, and the lowest panel a randomly selected cluster member galaxy that is representative of the quality of the MODS spectra.</p></div></div><div content-id=\"figa1\" class=\"fig fig-modal reveal-modal\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure A1.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/479/1/10.1093_mnras_sty1411/1/m_sty1411figa1.jpeg?Expires=1611465923&amp;Signature=IRbJDN0VV1BnvjIcQKWsUz3KrRcq6ArFrbZgz2VU~oZaG3DHGepNt8AupFqq5IROapahbpRTfEYNdWU9TrRxVo8YqgArNz9ceATPyEPsTnXTOR6Z~zMCsUrWHmaHWhLW-QbQMe3RuYHNTeSP4C74wBSKwornEy7u568Wk6qp9x~cRNXO6NMj-7Nvg8ElEzP0CBr9KO1BNfddWRqkq03ofYtcCRiOlPHAiZSW3X49S0jAIuPmIbloxtFSuqC1w5bVU9DFAf5CPf4jbnmwmov5mmO85~PSclqpX85UNdTw~32~hhdhIF0IwuH48LpSB9yx5X4Aa3AWADA-x62Q-O9U5A__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"Spectra of galaxies in the field of J1414+5446 targeted on MODS slitmasks. Spectra of the two candidate arcs R1 and R2 are presented in the top two panels; both are star-forming galaxies with strong emission lines. The unambiguous redshifts place them in the foreground of the lensing cluster. The third panel from the top shows the BCG spectrum, and the lowest panel a randomly selected cluster member galaxy that is representative of the quality of the MODS spectra.\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa1.jpg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/118502187/sty1411figa1.jpg\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa1.jpg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"118502187\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/479/1/10.1093_mnras_sty1411/1/sty1411figa1.jpeg?Expires=1611465923&Signature=lgvRZknAO-HatSCVQQSH5suXCtxj9tMFZLNtDTFlKUunwUa644In7Qx8beWRLCSJOR5YgX-S0P4xp1Lk6YJuv4icsVby1xsqvq2xJVLVbH3SvhRyUQnboDi~2DMWa9Htj5-sJp3EDBLRFXlKRfYhDmpsKXdjtbNVJMqYTisu4p6WyXSMHB9EM2GzKDnaWuYex0e8xUUpKIEedcH0lLFCgwvNyTcE643LatgT5Pg68sTTAtbfta3mOtpJHGO-HWHjE~bGAXOfuaz72QYHd3xTamrWvKoVzKEYNhOyqbi4-mBiNqEMKGF1Ghp5rd0nomAZmrDXUD6-YF1TCa3hE3~VTQ__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=118502187&ar=5026178&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa1.jpg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">Spectra of galaxies in the field of J1414+5446 targeted on MODS slitmasks. Spectra of the two candidate arcs R1 and R2 are presented in the top two panels; both are star-forming galaxies with strong emission lines. The unambiguous redshifts place them in the foreground of the lensing cluster. The third panel from the top shows the BCG spectrum, and the lowest panel a randomly selected cluster member galaxy that is representative of the quality of the MODS spectra.</p></div></div>                        <a id=\"118502188\" scrollto-destination=\"118502188\"></a>\r\n<div content-id=\"tbla1\" class=\"table-modal table-full-width-wrap\"><div class=\"table-wrap table-wide\"><div class=\"table-wrap-title\" id=\"tbla1\" data-id=\"tbla1\"><span class=\"label\">Table A1.</span><div class=\"caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">Redshifts of field galaxies.</p></div> </div><div class=\"table-overflow\"><table><thead><tr><th>RA (J2000)<span aria-hidden=\"true\" style=\"display: none;\">\r\n            .\u00a0</span></th><th>Dec. .\u00a0</span></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>213.63864\u00a0</td><td>54.80231\u00a0</td><td>20.37\u00a0</td><td>0.61207\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.63982\u00a0</td><td>54.80292\u00a0</td><td>21.09\u00a0</td><td>0.62854\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.64101\u00a0</td><td>54.76356\u00a0</td><td>21.61\u00a0</td><td>0.62484\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.64482\u00a0</td><td>54.77097\u00a0</td><td>17.18\u00a0</td><td>0.00000\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.64774\u00a0</td><td>54.80578\u00a0</td><td>20.40\u00a0</td><td>0.61501\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.64890\u00a0</td><td>54.76526\u00a0</td><td>20.82\u00a0</td><td>0.60856\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.65602\u00a0</td><td>54.77777\u00a0</td><td>21.88\u00a0</td><td>0.59960\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.65744\u00a0</td><td>54.81451\u00a0</td><td>21.26\u00a0</td><td>0.51609\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.66525\u00a0</td><td>54.78886\u00a0</td><td>19.93\u00a0</td><td>0.59645\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.66668\u00a0</td><td>54.81920\u00a0</td><td>21.41\u00a0</td><td>0.61464\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.66811\u00a0</td><td>54.80514\u00a0</td><td>20.54\u00a0</td><td>0.61257\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.66841\u00a0</td><td>54.78838\u00a0</td><td>19.71\u00a0</td><td>0.59668\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.66989\u00a0</td><td>54.80754\u00a0</td><td>21.24\u00a0</td><td>0.85058\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.68693\u00a0</td><td>54.79591\u00a0</td><td>21.11\u00a0</td><td>0.62238\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.68789\u00a0</td><td>54.76468\u00a0</td><td>20.08\u00a0</td><td>0.60376\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.69023\u00a0</td><td>54.78886\u00a0</td><td>20.95\u00a0</td><td>0.61697\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.69038\u00a0</td><td>54.80107\u00a0</td><td>21.77\u00a0</td><td>0.60402\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.69096\u00a0</td><td>54.80299\u00a0</td><td>21.75\u00a0</td><td>0.61283\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.69357\u00a0</td><td>54.79611\u00a0</td><td>21.00\u00a0</td><td>0.61429\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.69402\u00a0</td><td>54.78219\u00a0</td><td>23.21\u00a0</td><td>0.50876\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.69470\u00a0</td><td>54.78325\u00a0</td><td>19.56\u00a0</td><td>0.61347\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.69480\u00a0</td><td>54.79008\u00a0</td><td>19.83\u00a0</td><td>0.62059\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.69486\u00a0</td><td>54.75863\u00a0</td><td>20.62\u00a0</td><td>0.61276\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.69503\u00a0</td><td>54.74819\u00a0</td><td>21.95\u00a0</td><td>0.19803\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.69573\u00a0</td><td>54.82074\u00a0</td><td>21.76\u00a0</td><td>0.61585\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.69662\u00a0</td><td>54.78430\u00a0</td><td>18.32\u00a0</td><td>0.61562\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.69729\u00a0</td><td>54.80092\u00a0</td><td>20.30\u00a0</td><td>0.60472\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.69766\u00a0</td><td>54.79988\u00a0</td><td>21.78\u00a0</td><td>0.61200\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.69860\u00a0</td><td>54.80782\u00a0</td><td>20.31\u00a0</td><td>0.62577\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.69895\u00a0</td><td>54.78682\u00a0</td><td>21.15\u00a0</td><td>0.60836\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.69907\u00a0</td><td>54.75195\u00a0</td><td>19.29\u00a0</td><td>0.00000\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.69965\u00a0</td><td>54.78808\u00a0</td><td>20.93\u00a0</td><td>0.61550\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.69966\u00a0</td><td>54.75082\u00a0</td><td>21.79\u00a0</td><td>0.60437\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.70032\u00a0</td><td>54.78400\u00a0</td><td>21.64\u00a0</td><td>0.28546\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.70149\u00a0</td><td>54.79680\u00a0</td><td>22.09\u00a0</td><td>0.62181\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.70456\u00a0</td><td>54.79925\u00a0</td><td>22.26\u00a0</td><td>0.61868\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.70540\u00a0</td><td>54.78141\u00a0</td><td>22.18\u00a0</td><td>0.61843\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.70575\u00a0</td><td>54.78055\u00a0</td><td>21.49\u00a0</td><td>0.59664\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.70600\u00a0</td><td>54.76151\u00a0</td><td>19.73\u00a0</td><td>0.51899\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.70635\u00a0</td><td>54.80830\u00a0</td><td>21.62\u00a0</td><td>0.61173\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.70646\u00a0</td><td>54.78522\u00a0</td><td>21.57\u00a0</td><td>0.61511\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.70714\u00a0</td><td>54.76068\u00a0</td><td>21.65\u00a0</td><td>0.60930\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.70874\u00a0</td><td>54.82911\u00a0</td><td>18.55\u00a0</td><td>0.00000\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.71126\u00a0</td><td>54.74782\u00a0</td><td>21.75\u00a0</td><td>0.61017\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.71588\u00a0</td><td>54.74148\u00a0</td><td>18.80\u00a0</td><td>0.52287\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.71917\u00a0</td><td>54.75171\u00a0</td><td>20.90\u00a0</td><td>0.56825\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.71998\u00a0</td><td>54.75488\u00a0</td><td>21.22\u00a0</td><td>0.52187\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.72032\u00a0</td><td>54.76813\u00a0</td><td>21.19\u00a0</td><td>0.61002\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.72506\u00a0</td><td>54.74987\u00a0</td><td>21.16\u00a0</td><td>0.61393\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.72995\u00a0</td><td>54.77044\u00a0</td><td>22.08\u00a0</td><td>0.61455\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.73236\u00a0</td><td>54.76782\u00a0</td><td>21.52\u00a0</td><td>0.61254\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.73911\u00a0</td><td>54.79662\u00a0</td><td>21.19\u00a0</td><td>0.61576\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.74338\u00a0</td><td>54.79890\u00a0</td><td>21.05\u00a0</td><td>0.62441\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>213.74414\u00a0</td><td>54.77551\u00a0</td><td>19.72\u00a0</td><td>0.61317\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>213.74979\u00a0</td><td>54.80938\u00a0</td><td>21.63\u00a0</td><td>0.61607\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td><td>\u00a0</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class=\"&#xA;          graphic-wrap&#xA;          \"><a class=\"fig-view-orig openInAnotherWindow btn js-view-large\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"/view-large/118502188\">\r\n          Open in new tab\r\n        </a></div></div></div><p class=\"chapter-para\">We obtain a redshift of <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$z$|</span> = 0.285 for the candidate radial arc R1 from More et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib46\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib46\" data-open=\"bib46\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2012</a>), based on detections of O\u2009<span class=\"small-caps\">iii</span> 5007 and O\u2009<span class=\"small-caps\">ii</span> 3727, and a marginal detection of H\u00a0\u03b1. The R1 spectrum may be contaminated by a nearby galaxy to the NW (see Fig. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-figa2\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"figa2\" data-open=\"figa2\" class=\"link link-reveal link-table xref-fig\">A2</a>) and as such there remains some possibility that it is at higher redshift. The candidate arc R2 has a redshift of <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$z$|</span> = 0.509 based on O\u2009<span class=\"small-caps\">iii</span> 4959, 5007, and O\u2009<span class=\"small-caps\">ii</span> 3727. These redshifts place both of the objects in the foreground of the lensing mass, and thus they are not lensed arcs. Even with a total exposure time of \u223c9\u00a0h, we were unable to obtain signal on the candidate tangential arc T1. We first attempted to collapse the full 14-arcsec slit into a single 1D spectrum with uniform per-pixel weights. Next, we constructed a 1D slit profile matching the profile in the <em>HST</em> images in order to assign greater weight to the brighter knots associated with the galaxy. Neither method resulted in any detectable continuum or line emission. An image of the targets in the cluster centre is presented in Fig. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-figa2\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"figa2\" data-open=\"figa2\" class=\"link link-reveal link-table xref-fig\">A2</a>.</p>                        <a id=\"118502190\" scrollto-destination=\"118502190\"></a>\r\n<div data-id=\"figa2\" class=\"fig fig-section js-fig-section\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure A2.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/479/1/10.1093_mnras_sty1411/1/m_sty1411figa2.jpeg?Expires=1611465923&amp;Signature=QqJyJZlcc7bBKBCK6Tgf50xqPQW~dKrxE52G~SaulCgRcKt1JDRFI75INqacBbr1llrJgTlvl50JtTrxsFl9XwDtH0WSOjQu8naZJ9g1lTbHOweGL8HlOyfilk903cZdnQqvUigCdN3XhzUZUKjJ7J2cD6NbdL~a1KznrWJO4XdgPrukRBRBoDsNhRvvPnA26nfc~OXYb2fPs5DXZ12apIRxzISoRfZ33cULarPwrPySc5Sq0wLIg4R5yxpqQHZvRvzQ48BRk4QegfGS9QVOhZbXP6kmxVQknJoEGFIgmOw~MSg41D7ViXI4EyiOPZwZd7BqEfIhzQjtE92yjbBvkQ__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"Central \u223c20 arcsec of the lensing cluster SL2S J141447+544703 from the HST/WFC3 F125W image. Objects with MODS spectroscopy are labelled with their redshift just above the source, except for the candidate lensing arcs that are labelled with both their name and the redshift below the name. The data are unable to yield a redshift for the tangential arc T1. The two candidate radial arcs R1 and R2 are in the foreground of the cluster.\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa2.jpg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/118502190/sty1411figa2.jpg\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa2.jpg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"118502190\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/479/1/10.1093_mnras_sty1411/1/sty1411figa2.jpeg?Expires=1611465923&Signature=p3u8X4jsaLpANDIkocQS-oaxi4pgGAX-MxHFfX0~9I7gkt~-dNC6zyblCERy-oEH8sANXKWC9sIRAbfA3ERRTm0vpWVqER19pFeRq2m-9fy0V1tf3WdcnHaMzbZ5p4QAueIXpuPnQ8T8oepotFYJjoaG8hBSOpMFpZw8RvAkaAD1kcnOqc8PIBZlM7VAJppC1eGLORsTgj9sZSS7N0JFMJa-P-bz-TgzBwPhL9j6zRXj4qFbNAsdg~hme459J4IDEDPn16Q~O3uHd5amBDpSqj5Pw4s0QzXi6nHPh6DG7kGMm7pdeVCyrnENltj20End6E4WxXbzqP4VifOM7FcY9A__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=118502190&ar=5026178&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa2.jpg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">Central \u223c20 arcsec of the lensing cluster SL2S J141447+544703 from the <em>HST</em>/WFC3 F125W image. Objects with MODS spectroscopy are labelled with their redshift just above the source, except for the candidate lensing arcs that are labelled with both their name and the redshift below the name. The data are unable to yield a redshift for the tangential arc T1. The two candidate radial arcs R1 and R2 are in the foreground of the cluster.</p></div></div><div content-id=\"figa2\" class=\"fig fig-modal reveal-modal\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure A2.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/479/1/10.1093_mnras_sty1411/1/m_sty1411figa2.jpeg?Expires=1611465923&amp;Signature=QqJyJZlcc7bBKBCK6Tgf50xqPQW~dKrxE52G~SaulCgRcKt1JDRFI75INqacBbr1llrJgTlvl50JtTrxsFl9XwDtH0WSOjQu8naZJ9g1lTbHOweGL8HlOyfilk903cZdnQqvUigCdN3XhzUZUKjJ7J2cD6NbdL~a1KznrWJO4XdgPrukRBRBoDsNhRvvPnA26nfc~OXYb2fPs5DXZ12apIRxzISoRfZ33cULarPwrPySc5Sq0wLIg4R5yxpqQHZvRvzQ48BRk4QegfGS9QVOhZbXP6kmxVQknJoEGFIgmOw~MSg41D7ViXI4EyiOPZwZd7BqEfIhzQjtE92yjbBvkQ__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"Central \u223c20 arcsec of the lensing cluster SL2S J141447+544703 from the HST/WFC3 F125W image. The data are unable to yield a redshift for the tangential arc T1. The two candidate radial arcs R1 and R2 are in the foreground of the cluster.\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa2.jpg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/118502190/sty1411figa2.jpg\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa2.jpg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"118502190\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/479/1/10.1093_mnras_sty1411/1/sty1411figa2.jpeg?Expires=1611465923&Signature=p3u8X4jsaLpANDIkocQS-oaxi4pgGAX-MxHFfX0~9I7gkt~-dNC6zyblCERy-oEH8sANXKWC9sIRAbfA3ERRTm0vpWVqER19pFeRq2m-9fy0V1tf3WdcnHaMzbZ5p4QAueIXpuPnQ8T8oepotFYJjoaG8hBSOpMFpZw8RvAkaAD1kcnOqc8PIBZlM7VAJppC1eGLORsTgj9sZSS7N0JFMJa-P-bz-TgzBwPhL9j6zRXj4qFbNAsdg~hme459J4IDEDPn16Q~O3uHd5amBDpSqj5Pw4s0QzXi6nHPh6DG7kGMm7pdeVCyrnENltj20End6E4WxXbzqP4VifOM7FcY9A__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=118502190&ar=5026178&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"sty1411figa2.jpg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">Central \u223c20 arcsec of the lensing cluster SL2S J141447+544703 from the <em>HST</em>/WFC3 F125W image. Objects with MODS spectroscopy are labelled with their redshift just above the source, except for the candidate lensing arcs that are labelled with both their name and the redshift below the name. The data are unable to yield a redshift for the tangential arc T1. The two candidate radial arcs R1 and R2 are in the foreground of the cluster.</p></div></div>        <!-- /foreach -->\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n        <div class=\"article-metadata-standalone-panel "https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2018MNRAS.479..435M", "Tables status": "Complete", "Inspection status": "Incomplete", "Paper Overview": {"abstract": "We present a detailed study of an unusually bright, lensed galaxy at z = 5.424 discovered within the CFHTLS imaging survey. With an observed flux of i<SUB>AB</SUB> = 23.0, J141446.82+544631.9 is one of the brightest galaxies known at z &gt; 5. It is characterized by strong Ly \u03b1 emission, reaching a peak in (observed) flux density of &gt;10<SUP>-16</SUP>erg s<SUP>-1</SUP> cm<SUP>-2</SUP>\u00c5<SUP>-1</SUP>. A deep optical spectrum from the Large Binocular Telescope places strong constraints on N V and C IV emission, disfavouring an Active Galactic Nucleus (AGN) source for the emission. However, a detection of the N IV] \u03bb1486 emission line indicates a hard ionizing continuum, possibly from hot, massive stars. Resolved imaging from HST deblends the galaxy from a foreground interloper; these observations include narrowband imaging of the Ly \u03b1 emission, which is marginally resolved on approximately few kpc scales and has EW<SUB>0</SUB> \u223c 260 \u00c5. The Ly \u03b1 emission extends over \u223c2000 km s<SUP>-1</SUP> and is broadly consistent with expanding shell models. Spectral energy distribution fitting that includes Spitzer/IRAC photometry suggests a complex star formation history that includes both a recent burst and an evolved population. J1414+5446 lies 30 arcsec from the centre of a known lensing cluster in the CFHTLS; combined with the foreground contribution, this leads to a highly uncertain estimate for the lensing magnification in the range 5 \u2272 \u03bc \u2272 25. Because of its unusual brightness, J1414+5446 affords unique opportunities for detailed study of an individual galaxy near the epoch of re-ionization and a preview of what can be expected from upcoming wide-area surveys that will yield hundreds of similar objects.", "start_page": "435", "authors": ["McGreer, Ian D.", "Cl\u00e9ment, Benjamin", "Mainali, Ramesh", "Stark, Daniel P.", "Gronke, Max", "Dijkstra, Mark", "Fan, Xiaohui", "Bian, Fuyan", "Frye, Brenda", "Jiang, Linhua", "Kneib, Jean-Paul", "Limousin, Marceau", "Walth, Gregory"], "issn": "0035-8711", "custom1": "eprint: arXiv:1706.09428", "Title": "A bright-lensed galaxy at z = 5.4 with strong Ly \u03b1 emission", "type_of_reference": "JOUR", "keywords": ["(cosmology:) dark ages", "re-ionization", "first stars", "galaxies: high-redshift", "galaxies: individual: CFHTLS J141446.82+544631.9", "galaxies: ISM", "galaxies: groups: individual: SL2S J141447+544703", "gravitational lensing: strong", "Astrophysics - Astrophysics of Galaxies"], "volume": "479", "url": "https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2018MNRAS.479..435M", "end_page": "453", "number": "1", "publication_year": "2018/09/1", "doi": "10.1093/mnras/sty1411", "journal_name": "Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society", "author_address": ["AA(Steward Observatory, The University of Arizona, 933 North Cherry Avenue, Tucson, AZ 85721, USA;
